Eye of the Planesrunner (Rare).name: Eye of the Planesrunner (Rare)
Eye of the Planesrunner (Rare).description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement by a creature missing one eye)

This crystal sphere of shifting scenes depicts the landscape of the plane it last visited. An iridescent lattice borders the eye, developing in complexity the more it sees of the planes of existence.

You must have a missing eye to attune to this item. Once attuned to it, it takes the place of your missing eye, you can see through it as if it were a normal eye, and it can't be removed against your will.

Planar Magic. As an action, you can channel the eye's planar energy to cast one of the following spells (save DC 15): @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.pxpb2eOB6bv4phAf]{Banishment}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.GSvLWcdCZLQkilXT]{Blink}, and @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.dSTu1MaPhBqPITwM]{Contact Other Plane}.

Once this item has been used to cast a spell, roll a [[/r d8]]. If the result is equal to or lower than the level of the spell, the eye's energy floods into your brain; you take psychic damage equal to twice the number rolled and this property of the eye can't be used again until the next dawn.

Arm'onica (Uncommon).name: Arm'onica (Uncommon)
Arm'onica (Uncommon).description:
Wondrous item, uncommon (requires attunement by a creature missing one arm)

Pipes 'Fourarms' McGruff: infamous bardtender, caring cat-lover, and middling musician. Renowned for serving customers, petting his cat, and playing the harmonica simultaneously, his world was turned upside down in an unfortunate mimic-related piano tuning accident. Fortunately, a young Anton Spark was quick to Pipes' rescue, developing a tool capable of calming rowdy clients and ousting tricksy mimics. Inspired by local folk tales of a ridiculous, six-armed, top-hat-wearing creature, this prosthesis is known as the "Arm'onica".

You must have a missing arm to attune to the arm'onica. Once attuned to it, it takes the place of your missing arm and can't be removed against your will. In addition, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your bard spells, and if you are a bard, you gain a +1 bonus to your Bardic Inspiration rolls.

Dissonant Harmonies. As an action, you can blow into the arm'onica, choosing one of the effects below (save DC 13):

  • Harmony'ca. You cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.3MYDjS6k9IYL0aTj]{Calm Emotions} spell, which affects creatures in a 30-foot cone originating from you instead of a sphere originating from a point within range.

  • Harm'onica. You cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.WTbOQBsarsL1LuXJ]{Thunderwave} spell at 2nd level.

Once this item has been used to cast a spell, roll a [[/r d4]]. If the result is equal to or lower than the spell's level, the arm'onica becomes clogged and this property can't be used again until the next dawn, when it magically cleans itself.

Wings of Prey (Uncommon).name: Wings of Prey (Uncommon)
Wings of Prey (Uncommon).description:
Wondrous item, uncommon (requires attunement)

Bestowed upon defenders of city walls and mountain rangers alike, these wings provide great mobility, as well as packing a secret weapon. The appearance of the wings varies from one individual to another, shifting in colour to mirror their soul.

When you attune to the wings, they attach to your back and can't be removed against your will. As a bonus action, you can speak the wings' command word to cause them to disappear or reappear. Additionally, the wings have 3 and regain [[/r 1d3]] expended charges daily at dawn. While the wings are present, you have a flying speed equal to 5 times the number of remaining charges in feet.

Razor Sharp. As an action while the wings are present, you can expend 2 charges to hurl a flurry of razor-sharp feathers in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking [[/r 4d6]] slashing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flesh Symbiont, Heart (Very Rare).name: Flesh Symbiont, Heart (Very Rare)
Flesh Symbiont, Heart (Very Rare).description:
Wondrous item, very rare

This symbiont is the abominable side product of a crazed necromancer's arcane experimentation. Brimming with eyes and teeth, this beating lump of flesh vaguely resembles a humanoid heart.

Revive. As an action, you can press this heart to the chest of a humanoid corpse within reach. The heart burrows into the corpse's chest, consuming any existing heart. Over the course of 1 hour, it grows to resemble the original heart, casting the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.jhhT9PsHy5A7EojO]{Resurrection} spell on the creature. When cast in this way, the spell does not restore the missing heart that it replaces.

Curse. Pressing the heart into a creature forcibly attunes the creature to the heart and prevents it from being removed by any means. If the creature is already attuned to the maximum number of items, it loses its attunement to one at random. While attuned to the heart, the creature is cursed and has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks when it, the target of its attack, or whatever it's trying to perceive is in direct sunlight. In addition, it gains resistance to necrotic damage and can use the Symbiotic Vigor property. If a @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{Remove Curse} spell or similar magic is cast on the heart, or a creature ends its attunement to it, it rots and is destroyed, killing its host.

Symbiotic Vigor (Requires Attunement). The heart has 6 charges and regains [[/r 1d6]] charges daily at dawn. These charges manifest as lidless eyes appearing on random locations across your body. While the heart is inside you, you can use your reaction when you take damage to expend 1 charge to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.7e3QXF10hLNDEdr6]{False Life} spell at 3rd level, gaining the temporary hit points immediately before you take the triggering damage. You can't use this property of the heart while in direct sunlight. Whenever you expend a charge, one of the eyes closes.

Arm'onica (Very Rare).description:

  • Harmony'ca. You cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.91Sw6vOIaO7U8DvM]{Dominate Person} spell, which affects creatures in a 30-foot cone originating from you instead of a sphere originating from a point within range.

  • Harm'onica. You cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.WTbOQBsarsL1LuXJ]{Thunderwave} spell at 5th level.

Once this item has been used to cast a spell, roll a [[/r d10]]. If the result is equal to or lower than the spell's level, the arm'onica becomes clogged and this property can't be used again until the next dawn, when it magically cleans itself.

Mechanical Tail (Uncommon).name: Mechanical Tail (Uncommon)
Mechanical Tail (Uncommon).description:
Wondrous item, uncommon (requires attunement)

This item is another creation of the eccentric Anton Spark, tinkerer extraordinaire. This mechanical tail is powered by a magic-infused steam core. Any creature can wear it on its back and, once attuned, use it as if it was born with a tail.

When you attune to the mechanical tail, it attaches to your lower back and can't be removed against your will. You can use the tail to make grapples and have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to grapple creatures of your size or smaller with it.

Steam-Powered Strike. As an action, you can sweep your tail with wicked, steam-powered ferocity. Each creature within 5 feet of you must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/r 2d8]] slashing damage and is knocked prone. On a successful one, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. Once this property of the tail has been used, roll a [[/r d4]]. On a 1, the tail runs out of steam and this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Spiritual Armblade (Uncommon).name: Spiritual Armblade (Uncommon)
Spiritual Armblade (Uncommon).description:
Wondrous item, uncommon (requires attunement by a cleric or druid or monk or paladin or ranger or warlock missing one hand)

These magical prostheses were gifted to the warrior-servants of the divine in recompense for limbs lost in battle.

You must have a missing hand to attune to this item. Once attuned to it, it wraps itself around the site of your lost hand and can't be removed against your will.

Summon Armblade. As a bonus action, you can summon a simple melee weapon made of spiritual energy from the prosthetic, or cause it to disappear. You are proficient with this weapon and use your spellcasting ability for the attack rolls made with this weapon (or your Wisdom modifier if you are a monk). The weapon deals [[/r 2d8]] damage on a hit. Its appearance and damage type are linked to your alignment, as detailed below:

  • Good Alignment: A golden blade that deals radiant damage.

  • Neutral Alignment: A translucent-white weapon that deals force damage.

  • Evil Alignment: A shaft of bruised mauve that deals necrotic damage.

Shield. When a creature you can see attacks you while the weapon is summoned, you can use your reaction to shift it into a shield, gaining a +1 bonus to AC against the triggering attack. The shield reverts to a weapon immediately after.

Spiritual Armblade (Very Rare).description:

Tail of the Mermalia.name: Tail of the Mermalia
Tail of the Mermalia.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement by a creature missing one leg)

When the rakin ousted Dr. Stein from his tower, he had only one means of escape: swim. His last act in the battle was to sever his own legs, attune to the tail, flop into a well, and slink out into the sea, tail between his... well. He didn't have legs anymore.

You must have a missing leg to attune to this item. Once attuned to it, the tail grafts into place, the scales slowly petering out into your normal skin, and can't be removed against your will. You gain the shapechanger type and can breathe both air and water.

Morph. As an action, you can morph your legs into a tail or vice-versa, gaining the benefits indicated below:

  • Legs. You have a walking speed of 20 feet. You can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground.

  • Tail. You have a swimming speed of 60 feet and advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being grappled or restrained while underwater. On land, you are always prone, can't stand up, and have a walking speed of 5 feet.

Dolphin: Heads or Tails. As a bonus action, you can target one creature you can see within 60 feet of you and unleash the power of the chimaera. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be partially-@Compendium[dnd5e.spells.04nMsTWkIFvkbXlY]{Polymorph}ed for 1 minute. Roll a [[/r d6]] to determine the effect. Once this property of the item has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

  • On an even result, the creature's torso and head become fishified: it loses the ability to speak and can breathe only water. Furthermore, its Intelligence score is reduced to 1, and it can't cast spells or activate magic items, though it can still recognise its friends, follow them, and even protect them. The creature gains 10 temporary hit points. When these hit points are lost, or if the creature falls unconscious, the effect ends and it returns to normal.

  • On an odd result, the creature's legs become fishified, as described in the Tail option of the Morph property.

Tail of the Clownfish.description:

  • Tail. You have a swimming speed of 60 feet and advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being grappled or restrained while underwater. On land, you are always prone, can't stand up, and have a walking speed of 5 feet.

Clownfish: Clowning Around. As an action, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.BQk5Row4NymMnUQl]{Hideous Laughter} spell (save DC 15). This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dawn.

Wings of Prey (Rare).description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

When you attune to the wings, they attach to your back and can't be removed against your will. As a bonus action, you can speak the wings' command word to cause them to disappear or reappear. Additionally, the wings have 6 and regain [[/r 1d4 + 2]] expended charges daily at dawn. While the wings are present, you have a flying speed equal to 5 times the number of remaining charges in feet.

Razor Sharp. As an action while the wings are present, you can expend 2 charges to hurl a flurry of razor-sharp feathers in a 30-foot cone. Flesh Symbiont, Hand (Rare).name: Flesh Symbiont, Hand (Rare)
Flesh Symbiont, Hand (Rare).description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster missing one hand)

Crafted by Thumblemore the wizard, this cursed lump of dormant flesh needs a host to emerge from its slumber. It slowly attaches itself to the stump of a creature's lost hand, shifting hue and morphing its shape to represent the lost limb.

You must have a missing hand to attune to this item. Once attuned to it, it takes the place of your missing hand and functions as a normal hand. The results aren't always perfect; roll [[/r 1d6 + 1]] to determine the number of digits your new hand has. The first digit is always a thumb, and a mouth forms in the hand's palm.

Cost. The symbiont feeds off of you, syphoning your magical energy. Each time you finish a long rest, you must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you lose one spell slot of the lowest level you can cast.

Mockery. You can use the hand to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.cdrYKaFi98YWaBMw]{Vicious Mockery} and @Compendium[larsene-ledger-treasures-and-trinkets.loot-tavern-08-body-augmentation-item.kOI3d9nNhc0rojgy]{Words of Discouragement} spells at will, using your spell save DC. If a creature succeeds on its saving throw against a @Compendium[larsene-ledger-treasures-and-trinkets.loot-tavern-08-body-augmentation-item.kOI3d9nNhc0rojgy]{Words of Discouragement} spell cast in this way, the mouth blurts out insults and mockeries at you, causing you to become timorous for 1 minute, as per the spell. As a bonus action while timorous, you can punish your insolent hand, taking [[/r 1d4]] bludgeoning damage, restoring your sense of self-worth, and ending this effect.

Symbiotic Nature. The symbiont can't be removed from you while you're attuned to it, and you can't voluntarily end your attunement to it. If you're targeted by a spell that ends a curse, your attunement to the symbiont ends and it falls off, reverting to a dormant lump of flesh.

Silver Tongue. The tongue in the mouth on your hand becomes silvered. You can use the hand to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.zMAWdyc8UVb37BK4]{Suggestion} spell, using your spell save DC. Once this property of the hand has been used, roll a [[/r d4]]. On a 1 or 2, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Spiritual Armblade (Legendary).description:

  • Good Alignment: A golden blade that deals radiant damage.

  • Neutral Alignment: A translucent-white weapon that deals force damage.

  • Evil Alignment: A shaft of bruised mauve that deals necrotic damage.

Phantom Limb (Rare).name: Phantom Limb (Rare)
Phantom Limb (Rare).description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement by a creature missing one limb)

This nebulous, floating cluster of green-blue light can take the form of a hand, arm, foot, leg, or similar absent appendage. Despite its spectral appearance, the phantom limb is quite solid—a fact that becomes painfully evident to unfortunate creatures on the receiving end of its strikes.

You must have a missing limb to attune to this item. Once attuned to it, it takes the place of your missing limb, functions as a normal limb, and can't be removed against your will. As a bonus action, you can cause the phantom limb to disappear, or manifest again. If you have multiple phantom limbs, they count as a single magic item with regard to the number of magic items to which you can attune.

Unarmed strikes made with the phantom limb and attacks made with weapons held by the phantom limb deal an extra [[/r 1d6]] psychic damage to the first target they hit each turn.

Mage Limb. As an action, you can cause the limb to detach from your body and manipulate it like the hand produced by the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3]{Mage Hand} spell. The limb vanishes when you dismiss it (no action required) and reappears attached to you once more.

Limber. The reach of unarmed strikes made with the phantom limb and the reach of attacks made with weapons that have light property held by the phantom limb increases by 5 feet.

A timorous creature that succeeds on ability check or attack roll is no longer timorous. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't become timorous.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial psychic damage increases by [[/r 1d8]] for each slot level above 1st.

Ornate Ceramic Prosthesis (Rare).name: Ornate Ceramic Prosthesis (Rare)
Ornate Ceramic Prosthesis (Rare).description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement by a creature missing one limb)

Developed by a mysterious puppeteer, the painted patterns that decorate the ceramic surface of this appendage seem to shift from day to day, and vary in texture and hue from one individual to another.

You must have a missing limb to attune to this item. Once attuned to it, it reshapes itself to take the place of your missing limb, functions as a normal limb, and can't be removed against your will.

When you make an unarmed strike using this prosthesis, its plating morphs into a sharp, ceramic blade. Unarmed strikes made with the prosthesis count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage and deal slashing damage equal to [[/r 1d6]] + your Strength modifier.

Full Plating. As an action, you can speak the prosthesis' command word to activate the ceramic plating. It grows to cover your entire body, giving you the appearance of an articulated porcelain doll for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. Additionally, you have vulnerability to bludgeoning damage and resistance to fire and slashing damage. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dawn.

Phantom Limb (Uncommon).name: Phantom Limb (Uncommon)
Phantom Limb (Uncommon).description:
Wondrous item, uncommon (requires attunement by a creature missing one limb)

This nebulous, floating cluster of green-blue light can take the form of a hand, arm, foot, leg, or similar absent appendage. Despite its spectral appearance, the phantom limb is quite solid—a fact that becomes painfully evident to unfortunate creatures on the receiving end of its strikes.

You must have a missing limb to attune to this item. Once attuned to it, it takes the place of your missing limb, functions as a normal limb, and can't be removed against your will. As a bonus action, you can cause the phantom limb to disappear, or manifest again. If you have multiple phantom limbs, they count as a single magic item with regard to the number of magic items to which you can attune.

Mage Limb. As an action, you can cause the limb to detach from your body and manipulate it like the hand produced by the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3]{Mage Hand} spell. The limb vanishes when you dismiss it (no action required) and reappears attached to you once more.

Limber. The reach of unarmed strikes made with the phantom limb and the reach of attacks made with weapons that have light property held by the phantom limb increases by 5 feet.

Tail of the Shark.name: Tail of the Shark
Tail of the Shark.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement by a creature missing one leg)

When the rakin ousted Dr. Stein from his tower, he had only one means of escape: swim. His last act in the battle was to sever his own legs, attune to the tail, flop into a well, and slink out into the sea, tail between his... well. He didn't have legs anymore.

You must have a missing leg to attune to this item. Once attuned to it, the tail grafts into place, the scales slowly petering out into your normal skin, and can't be removed against your will. You gain the shapechanger type and can breathe both air and water.

Morph. As an action, you can morph your legs into a tail or vice-versa, gaining the benefits indicated below:

  • Legs. You have a walking speed of 20 feet. You can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground.

  • Tail. You have a swimming speed of 60 feet and advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being grappled or restrained while underwater. On land, you are always prone, can't stand up, and have a walking speed of 5 feet.

Shark: Blood Fury. As a bonus action, you can activate your blood fury. For 1 minute, when you make a weapon attack against a creature, you have advantage on your attack roll if the creature has fewer than half of its maximum hit points. Once you use this property, you can’t do so again until the next dawn.

Mechanical Tail (Legendary).name: Mechanical Tail (Legendary)
Mechanical Tail (Legendary).description:
Wondrous item, legendary (requires attunement)

This item is another creation of the eccentric Anton Spark, tinkerer extraordinaire. This mechanical tail is powered by a magic-infused steam core. Any creature can wear it on its back and, once attuned, use it as if it was born with a tail.

When you attune to the mechanical tail, it attaches to your lower back and can't be removed against your will. You can use the tail to make grapples and have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to grapple creatures two sizes larger than you or smaller with it.

Steam-Powered Strike. As an action, you can sweep your tail with wicked, steam-powered ferocity. Each creature within 5 feet of you must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/r 5d10]] slashing damage and is knocked prone. On a successful one, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. Once this property of the tail has been used, roll a [[/r d4]]. On a 1, the tail runs out of steam and this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Eye of the Planesrunner (Uncommon).name: Eye of the Planesrunner (Uncommon)
Eye of the Planesrunner (Uncommon).description:
Wondrous item, uncommon (requires attunement by a creature missing one eye)

This crystal sphere of shifting scenes depicts the landscape of the plane it last visited. An iridescent lattice borders the eye, developing in complexity the more it sees of the planes of existence.

You must have a missing eye to attune to this item. Once attuned to it, it takes the place of your missing eye, you can see through it as if it were a normal eye, and it can't be removed against your will.

Planar Magic. As an action, you can channel the eye's planar energy to cast one of the following spells (save DC 13): @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.GSvLWcdCZLQkilXT]{Blink}.

Once this item has been used to cast a spell, roll a [[/r d6]]. If the result is equal to or lower than the level of the spell, the eye's energy floods into your brain; you take psychic damage equal to twice the number rolled and this property of the eye can't be used again until the next dawn.
